timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we only call maybeClosePreviousIterationScope() if delegateIterator.hasNext() returns false? I mean you could call hasNext() and still do some work before you call next().
timeline.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: Thanks. I think your suggestion covers more cases.
replies.author: lpriima

timeline.bodyText: I'm curious why we only do tracing on the first iterator. What is the rationale?
timeline.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText:
rationale here is the "hope" that iteration will be performed only once in thread:
https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/blob/master/dd-java-agent/instrumentation/kafka-clients-0.11/src/main/java/datadog/trace/instrumentation/kafka_clients/TracingIterable.java#L25
that's the assumption so far.
replies.author: lpriima

replies.bodyText: Yes, I get that, but what is the downside of always returning a TracingListIterator?
replies.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: every iteration will add spans. No obvious downsides which I can see. I think the instrumentation before supported only the very basic code pattern. I've changed it.
